website_summaries.verdict: The CB35-B3340 Chromebook 2, Toshiba's second inexpensive Chrome OS laptop, is a solid system with a full HD display, Skullcandy speakers, and 4GB of memory, but it doesn't stand out in this increasingly competitive category.
pros: Large 13-inch display with full HD resolution
Comes with 100GB cloud storage and two months unlimited Google Music
Double the usual RAM for smoother browsing
cons: Minor color shifting when viewing display off-center

customer_reviews.title: Known issue: screen dies after a few months. Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It was a great laptop,... until it died on us 15 months later. If you browse the more than three hundred 1-start reviews, they're all largely about the same: an issue with the screen that renders it obsolete. That's what happened to us. We're just outside of the rather humble 1 year warranty, so we're screwed. Reading other reviews, it probably wouldn't have mattered anyways: it seems clear that Toshiba is unwilling to take ownership for this issue with the display and that their customer support is sorely lacking. Stay away from this product. It has lots of great features, but it's all moot if it's practically guaranteed not to last a mere 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kat/Seb

customer_reviews.title: non touchscreen. Beautiful screen. good battery.
customer_reviews.text: This screen has higher pixel density and clarity than an apple air. It also weighs nearly the same. Basically you're getting a macbook air looking device (it is plastic though), for 1/5th the price. Except the screen is BETTER. Not joking. It doesn't have a great processor, so sometimes 1080p video gets choppy. But that wimpy processor saves battery life. It's a great bargain, but there are better newer devices out there. I'm typing from a 300e lenovo for example.
customer_reviews.author: David Broussard

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best Chromebooks made
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly secure, fast (enough), full-HD screen. This is one of the best Chromebooks made. Arguably, better even than the 2015 model by Toshiba which trades this model's great battery life for performance. The only model I can is say definitively superior is the Google Pixel, which carries a price tag 4-5 times higher. Basically, this thing is a bargain. I use this machine for running a tech startup and for software development. The only applications it could really use would be the Adobe suite, which I use on another system. I do development with machines in the cloud using an SSH client, but Codenvy is a great option for those looking for an IDE (Eclipse).
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook screen failure within three months
customer_reviews.text: After three months of normal use, my chromebook also developed vertical lines on the screen. The laptop has been used in my home and not abused in any way. In addition, I experienced the same response from Toshiba in that they will not honor the warranty for this failure. Given the number of other reviews from others reporting this same problem, it appears the Toshiba chromebook has a design defect. I would expect a laptop to last longer than two months and was extremely displeased with this purchase and the Toshiba customer service.
customer_reviews.author: R.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device, best value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The Toshiba CB35-B3340 is the only chromebook available with 4gb of ram, a 1080p display, and a 2.14ghz celeron for under $300. Despite the sensible price, this chromebook is no slouch. The keyboard is accurate and reliable, and the touchpad is responsive. Battery life is excellent as can be expected from a chromebook, though slightly less than either of the lower-spec variants. It does everything I need and more, and has completely replaced my windows tablet for daily tasks. Though you forfeit the ability to use Windows desktop applications with a chromebook, you in turn get exceptional battery life, smooth and reliable operation, and timely updates all for the same price as a much less capable windows device.
customer_reviews.author: B. Columbus

customer_reviews.title: Having the USB and other ports have been very useful as I still require a laptop with plug-in features
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical before purchasing because I didn't know anyone with a chromebook. I purchased it to replace my dated Mac Book Pro (2007) which Apple really no longer supports. I've been very impressed with the features, it's light weight, battery life and speed. Having the USB and other ports have been very useful as I still require a laptop with plug-in features. I would not hesitate to recommend Chromebooks to anyone. This model has excellent speakers and the build quality is excellent. Shipping was super fast which always helps and setup was simple as I'm not really knowledgable with computers.
customer_reviews.author: J Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook out there right now
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful 1080p HD screen. Really lightweight. Good battery life. Great track pad with multi-gesture commands. Start up time is super fast. Only complaint is it does get a little laggy when you have more than 5 or so tabs open, but that doesn't happen too much so not a big complaint. I was a little hesitant to make the jump from a Windows based laptop to Chrome, but so far I haven't had any problems. I was already heavily invested in Google since I have an Android phone, and I use Gmail and Google Drive, so the switch just made sense. The "apps" for Spotify and Netflix have made the switch even easier. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JDogg

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little laptop. Plenty of processor horsepower to do anything that can be done with Chrome. Am considering putting it in development mode and loading Ubuntu. But, as it runs clean and serves the purpose it was purchased for, I'm ambivalent about modifying the filesystem. The display is more than adequate, and sound is surprisingly punchy for such a lightweight system. Build is all plastic, very solid and no rattling or bendiness. Recommended as a step between a full fat laptop and a tablet. I personally find Chrome much nicer than Windows 8.x. It truly makes a computer that you can jump right in and use intuitively.
customer_reviews.author: dunelt_1954

customer_reviews.title: As far as I can tell there's really only one good chromeOS photo editor (Polarr)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cheap replacement for a dead windows laptop. I do a limited number of things with my computers: email, shop, social media, amazon instant video/netflix, and photo editing. It does four of the five really, really well. It's ok with photo editing. As far as I can tell there's really only one good chromeOS photo editor (Polarr). I realize that's more a criticism of ChromeOS than the laptop, but it's kinda one and the same being a chrome book. Pros: light weight, bright sharp screen, long battery life Cons: Feels a little 'under-powered' when doing things like photo editing (big files)
customer_reviews.author: ARK413

customer_reviews.title: Best display, build quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to serve as an interim laptop until the next round of Macbook releases. Has become the go to machine for couch surfing, web and email. Quality construction and really the best Chromebook display out there for hi-res duty. Works well with Chromecast and seldom shudders on the most hi-res streaming video content. Speakers are loud enough to stream with the Sirius Chrome app and use as a mobile listening platform around the house. Install a Chrome RDP app and use it to access another pc. Only drawback is no support for some of the third party VPN services out there.
customer_reviews.author: nu3ll

customer_reviews.title: mouse cursor vanished
customer_reviews.text: Touchpad failed, the mouse cursor disappeared and I couldn't get it back despite multiple powerwash, etc. Saw online that others with the same issue had to send it back for repairs. Luckily I was still within the return window for amazon. Disappointing. I know these are cheaper, but the quality could certainly be better.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked it fine until it broke. It lasted for 3 years, then, for nor reason, the hinge on the right side of the screen broke through the frame. I tried a home repair and kept it going for a while. Now it is dead. There is a metal hinge set in the plastic that became too stiff to move and broke the frame. I know these things don’t last forever, but I don’t expect laptops to just self destruct because of poor build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alfie

customer_reviews.title: Seller doesn't back up products!
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is fine, just what I expected. The seller, however was quite a disappointment, The laptop fell apart 35 days after use and is no longer usable. The seller suggested I reach out to the manufacturer, but denied my request to return the faulty product. The manufacturer of course will not do anything about a refurbished laptop. The seller should back up the products they sell and offer some kind of resolution but they have closed the case. Don't buy from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: wiley

customer_reviews.title: This is by far my favorite device to use
customer_reviews.text: Previous Mac user. This is by far my favorite device to use. I have an Acer Desktop and recently came into an Asus Zenbook (which is great,too). I love the simplicity of this device's OS. PROS: The screen is beautiful and bright Speakers are decent (blows the $750 Zenbook out of the water) Keyboard is simple and durable (I've had this for about a year now) Super fast and responsive Track pad is accurately responsive CONS: No RAM for utilizing programs... but this isn't even really a con because this is a Chromebook and it's standard for these devices!
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Love it, except for the tiny text in the web browser tabs and...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a laptop alternative for traveling, and use it for grad school work. The screen is gorgeous, and the sound is good, and it's a great size. The only thing I really don't like is the tiny tiny text on the Chrome tabs, bookmarks bar, and the URL address box. Enlarging text on a web page is no big deal, just hit Ctrl+, but the only way to enlarge that microscopic text in the tabs and other controls in the web browser is to change the display resolution. I did that and the screen now looks crappy, which totally defeats the purpose of the gorgeous screen. Wish I could find a work around for that.
customer_reviews.author: arm0110

customer_reviews.title: quality screen and overall design
customer_reviews.text: So far the Toshiba Chromebook meets expectations. Beautiful screen and attractive build. I like the keyboard feel and its responsive enough for practical work. Connecting to our home printer using Cloud Print was straightforward enough once I found directions. Why not five stars? The chassis has a lot of flex compared to the laptops and tablets I've had the most experience with, Apple and Lenovo. That flex detracts slightly from my impressions. That said, so far it is a great 'homework tool' for the kids, which is the principle mission for the Chromebook. I especially like how its directed to doing work, and the integration with 2-factor authentication.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5.5 years of daily use
customer_reviews.text: Amazing chromebook. 5.5 years of daily use and it is still going great and strong. Couldn't ask for a better one. Google keeps it up to date and the hardware is really made to last
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Balla

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Google chromebook as well as my last. The toshiba chromebook itself it great! This toshiba is very thin, lightweight, and has the best speakers for a laptop I've ever heard. It could use about 10 times the amount of disk space it currently has. The screen has a lot of glare! As far as the Google OS..... Can't say I like it, but I don't hate it either. It's a bit difficult getting used to but I enjoy how basic the operating system is. This computer literally boots up in a couple second. The computer lags with multitasking. I'd say this computer is great for students, with all the Google apps available, it's size, and affordability.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna Newton

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing deal. Still can't believe I have gotten 4 years out of this thing and still going strong. Incredibly bright beautiful display - can use outside in full sun. I am finally looking to upgrade and can't find anything even close to as good for the price I payed for this. Even the brand new Google Pixel Go doesn't have as bright a display.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major product defect - do not buy this laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Within six months of normal use, the screen on this laptop suddenly failed. Toshiba claimed that it was physical damage and is refusing to honor the warranty. The laptop was never dropped, and in fact was never even taken out of our home, so I can't imagine how poorly this product would perform if it were routinely transported (like laptops are designed to be). We are very disappointed in the poor quality of this product, and the pathetic response from Toshiba Customer Service. I will certainly never buy another Toshiba product again!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Yu

customer_reviews.title: Love how light this book is
customer_reviews.text: Love how light this book is, how quickly it boots. I have a deep respect for Toshiba systems, I felt confident in my choice for a notebook. However, the significant lack of technical knowledge base related to CHROME OS, was disappointing. The missing additional software/(full recovery discs) specific on this because it is a Toshiba Chromebok 2 is frustrating. There are no recovery discs to use or make just in case. I appreciate the low price to fit my budget but....limited support, limited peripheral/network adapters to work with this brand.....already looking for a better fit with my schedule at home & work. I wish I could get a few more options & more bang for the bucks I did spend.
customer_reviews.author: jwatters74

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who don't need a laptop, and don't want a tablet
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has a gaming desktop, and has a smartphone this is perfect. I don't need a laptop that can game and do a lot of offline stuff, I just needed something where I could browse the internet and watch videos off of. I was tired of staring at my phone all day, and tablets aren't really for me. So all that said, this chromebook is a laptop that's lightweight, has a beautiful screen, and has a long lasting battery. Couldn't really be more happy with it. Oh and it's cheap, that's another plus
customer_reviews.author: Slayner

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook for a GREAT price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this laptop for a few months now and I can say the following: I now use it as my go to laptop, it replaced my Windows laptop. It's extremely light-weight The screen is phenomenal for the price. Boot up time is excellent, within 5 seconds it's up and running. Added bonus -- 100GB upgrade for google drive. I purchased this shortly after it was released and got it a great price- I have seen this going for more than 350.00 now. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a Chromebook. It definitely has one of the, if not THE best screens available on Chromebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Higareda

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, no complaints. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for the web and more. Do not expect to do any photo/video editing but for getting on the web and emails and google docs it is great. YouTube and Vimeo stream smoothly and the colors are great. Only thing is that Google updates these chromebooks for limited period of time, about 5 years so check Google site as to the time left as from then on they do not provide updates on viruses. To bad as these are a great business/school/web device, especially for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: 35years in trades

customer_reviews.title: Lag-free even with 30-40 tabs up, a high quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Toshiba Chromebook 2. It's fast and lag-free even with 30-40 tabs up, a high quality product that can easily be mistaken for a macbook even though it's plastic, and an awesome HD screen with deep blacks. I had a defect in this product that made the screen go yellow, likely due to insufficient glue connecting the display connector, but I sent it in and in less than a month they had the product repaired and returned to me, free of charge, no cost for shipping or anything. My repaired Chromebook has since continued operating issue free. I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Overall I like it except I wish the battery lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Chromebook for about 1.5 months. Overall I like it except I wish the battery lasted longer. The screen is very clear although some text in chrome os appears very small (eg tabs and url address). One glaring problem is the screw fasteners on the bottom. One of mine fell out and 2 others checked out loose! I have never run into a fastener problem with a laptop computer before. Locktite should be applied to these screws but appears not to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop from Toshiba!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this laptop for 11 months now almost a year in May and its been really reliable and the best Chromebook i could have purchased. The display is impressive 1080 full HD display and also the screen (13.3) is a really good size, the reason i didn't give 5 stars is because the processing power could be a little more better using a old Intel Celeron is a bit of a bummer but it still has good graphics and all that good stuff, and its really fast i can have more than 10 tabs open and runs great. My conclusion is i got my money's worth and plan on keeping it for a good while thank you Toshiba!
customer_reviews.author: Ken J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and picture quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2014 for daughter. O used it a lot and love it! No issues. Bought a bigger Acer for younger daughter this year. Sound and picture quality no where near as good as Toshiba! Acer even has big speakers beside keyboard but I can't hear it very well. Sigh. Love the Toshiba chrome book
customer_reviews.author: KCN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent -
customer_reviews.text: My H-P Chrome laptop battery died, a replacement battery was rather expensive $99 and installation would have been problematic - likely resulting in damage to connections and/or components. This replacement computer was slightly more expensive than simply replacing the original H-P, but rated a full 'star' higher by Amazon buyers. It was easy to set up and get going, and given the Cloud-based nature of storage associated with Chrome, my passwords and favorite sites were immediately recalled. Display and audio are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Loyd Eskildson

customer_reviews.title: It's fast, it's pretty, but don't expect it to be your one and only computer.
customer_reviews.text: A chromebook is exactly what it says it is: a chrome browser terminal. I've had a lot of challenges using this thing with apps that said they were compatible with chromebooks but weren't really. I'm even having significant trouble with offline google drive. You have been warned: tech support's answer for everything is to return your computer to factory settings, and you will run into problems now and then, there is no point in having much hard drive space because you will wipe it from time to time. The nice thing is that all your settings go with you and "powerwash" takes about as long as an older PC does just to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chrombook !
customer_reviews.text: Awesome deal for my parents. Their PC went out and they wanted something easy and portable which I was sure about since they are of late age. And had always had a key board and mouse. Wow, I was so pleasantly surprised with the ChromeBook ! Easy to set up , keyboard since they type differently than me had no issue and I am learning from them...! Perfect and easy , I am even considering one for me. Make life simple with all you need ! The price ! Incredible ! I did pay 30 $ more but noticed it came down within 7 days and Amazon refunded me the difference ! Thanks for the great Chomebook !
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Stone

customer_reviews.title: Get a different model/brand
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little Chromebook while it lasts. I bought mine in April of 2016, I ended up giving it to my wife since I wanted a little bit more from a laptop. She had no issues with it until just a day or two ago when it would die after unplugging it. The battery stays at 46% and won't charge. I did some research online and it sounds like there is a loose wire inside. As long as you leave it plugged in, there are no issues. But the moment you unplug it.... it automatically dies. I'm a little disappointed for a computer that is less than 2.5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great display!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cruise the web in my living room and to do simple tasks like check email. It's a nice machine with a great display. The colors pop and aren't washed out like they are with cheaper Chromebooks. It's not a speed demon, but it's not a slouch either. It can take a few seconds to connect to the internet when you open up the lid. Other than that, I love this thing. The simplicity of a tablet but with the form factor of a laptop. It also has one of the best keyboards I've ever typed on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: 3 and was not happy the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: i previously purchased the asus chromebook 13.3 and was not happy the keyboard,the whole hardware felt cheap.the m key was comong off so i returned it after 5 days.got my new toshiba chromebook 6/30.LOVE IT! the ips display is such a big difference,the feel of this computer is quality.i almost forget its a chromebook.the key board is great,it responds to the touch.it just feels right.what would make the this chromebook out of this world if the hardware was made of aluminum,like my daughters samsung chromebook.overall i am happy with this purchase,and i will recomend this to any looking for an alternative to a laptop to surf,shop,emails,this is the perfect tool,peroid.
customer_reviews.author: Precious

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong after 5 years of frequent use including grad school, personal/entertainment, professional. Glad I made the purchase
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for school aged kids.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer for the price. We purchased this laptop for my daughter. Being a Google based laptop it is extremely easy to use. Unlike my other daughter for whom we bought a Windows based laptop a couple of years ago, there are never any complaints of it "not working" because of updates, etc. This computer made it through the entire school year without a single complaint or issue. We purchased a snap on cover for it which kept it in great condition. I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Supermanick007Top Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great value in this system.
customer_reviews.text: Picked one of these up a couple of weeks ago, replaced my IPad that Apple made unusable with ISO 8.x. Thought about getting a 13 inch Macbook Pro, it became an easy choice once I decided what I really wanted to do with a portable machine and factored in price. I got my Chromebook for $329 from Amazon and am very pleased with it. Great screen, really nice keyboard, it's not heavy and has a good looking case. Chrome appears to have very good memory management, I like it so much I've made it the default browser on my IMac.
customer_reviews.author: Merkin Muffley

customer_reviews.title: Really great buy
customer_reviews.text: This netbook is great. I use it for surfing and some light cloud work. It handles 15 tabs just fine and the speed is better than i thought. The only thing I was a little skeptical about was the ability to really do 1080p well with such little proc power and onboard graphics. No issues, it pretty much kicks ass and the screen is just excellent. My only issue at first was the mac-like keyboard but I got used to it. I really couldn't be happier with the purchase. It delivered exactly what I wanted in a netbook.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: As far as getting what you paid for - this laptop delivers. It's light, easy to use, fast, and handles smoothly and cleanly with very few errors. If you aren't a Chromebook user it will take some time getting used to and be prepared to do without some familiar programs you may have gotten used to in the past. My advice if you're considering whether to purchase this or a Microsoft/Mac would be to decide which features/programs are most useful to do and then research if they are available for Chromebook. Other than that, I have been using this laptop for 4 months and am very happy with the battery life and overall performance.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: not recommended for primary
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one month and one year ago. Works well for a secondary computer, not recommended for primary. Software is not compatible with multiple online sites/programs. The worst part was the battery died ONE MONTH after the one year warranty expired so now it can't operate unplugged (did have a good battery like 6-8 hours previously). Recommend another product.
customer_reviews.author: acook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my dad and got to use it for a couple of weeks. This is a very good laptop replacement for the price. Screen is bright and clear, overall construction is sturdy and internals have enough juice to drive typical web applications. It is light and runs cool and quiet. Battery runs a good 6-7 hours on high brightness. The chrome OS learning curve is not steep. My dad got a hang of it in a couple of days. I will consider buying this for myself when my current laptop is ready to retire.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't weigh so is really comfortable to use it laying in bed and on your ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen is gorgeous! boots extremely fast, just open and it's on, It doesn't weigh so is really comfortable to use it laying in bed and on your lap, doesn't overheat, virus are nonexistent so that's a relief and it also updates on its own. Definitely this was one of the best purchases. It's as easy as just plug and play and things keep going better. Oh and just discover it works with casting to TV in case you need a bigger screen.
customer_reviews.author: Hassing

customer_reviews.title: Great until screen died.
customer_reviews.text: Great notebook while it lasted. After 14 months of carefree and pleasant light use, the screen started to fail. Screen flickers and fades in and out. Looks like when you used to see old crt displays on a tv recoding. Those big show moving discolored bars scrolling up and down. Going to try to use the warranty but I'm not hopeful at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this little Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this little Chromebook. I use google drive for grad school and to assemble my teaching materials, and this thing never lets me down. After a few months, I'm still excited. While I use it for work purposes (I have a custom desktop for all my gaming and real hardware needs), it's great for late night Netflix marathons too. The speakers are amazing, for any laptop I've known. People keep thinking I have a Macbook, because the design is very close. The hinge on the screen is nice and sturdy, and the machine runs quietly (unless using the aforementioned speakers). I love this Chromebook so much, I wrote my first Amazon review about it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Harris-Hoffstrom

customer_reviews.title: wonky keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Everwything ewads grewat until my keyboard dstated doing thids. The W, S, X, 2 keys dont work after having the computer for 10 months. This rewview ewould have been longerw but it takeds foreverw to type anything noew.
customer_reviews.author: HiderSeeker

customer_reviews.title: Before you pop for a Google Pixel, try one of these and keep $1000
customer_reviews.text: I am a Chromebook fan. I make my living in IT and doing varied techie and netly work. I like being able to do all my work with almost no equipment overhead and hassle. I almost popped for a Google Chromebook Pixel i7 ($1300 clams) and then read about this. Great, brightly lit screen and good sound. Full HD. Pop in a USB nub flash drive for more local storage (if you need it). Over $1000 less than the Pixel. What have I got to lose? Couldn't be happier now. Someday may still pop for a Pixel, but not today or tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Nami

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what others complaint about the screen brightness and sharpness because I think it's great. I guess some people are
customer_reviews.text: This is the second chromebook for me and it is definitely an improvement over the first one. I don't know what others complain about the screen brightness and sharpness because I think it's great. I guess some people are just super critical. If you are not totally dependent on Microsoft to do your tasks then this is the book for you. Love that the updates and virus protection are taken care of even before they can get to you. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wardblvd

customer_reviews.title: still playing around so i'll update as needed but right out the gate this Chromebook is great. its not heavy
customer_reviews.text: just received yesterday... still playing around so i'll update as needed but right out the gate this Chromebook is great. its not heavy, but it feels solid unlike a lot of other chromebooks which just feel light, cheap, and plastic-y. the screen resolution is absolutely beautiful; i cant choose between all the different default wallpapers. they all so such artistic and beautiful photos that really do a great justice to the screen. this is my first Chromebook so i'm still getting use to the ChromeOS. it is different but has been capable of doing everything i would do normally so far. i'm definitely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: adam breznicky

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic computer
customer_reviews.text: I use it for writing...but HD screen is great, reviews all over are A+, price is ridiculous, a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: (Probably) The Only Laptop You Need
customer_reviews.text: For most people, this is the only laptop you need. This Chromebook is THE Chromebook to own right now. Fast, pretty display, excellent 1080p output, awesome battery life. Came with a free 1TB of Google Drive space (until the beginning of January 2014). Audio sounds pretty good, tested using over-ear and in-ear headphones, sounds great. Turns on in about three seconds, wakes up in one. Connects to wireless very fast, including the PEAP/WPA2; compared to a Macbook, this is remarkably fast connection as far as time to connect. Physically, this Chromebook is both pretty and sturdy. While it's about the same size as the 13'' Macbook Air, this machine does not feel fragile. It's well built. I would recommend, 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: MTJ

customer_reviews.title: If you love Chromebooks then you will love this little baby.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is every bit as advertised. It's lightweight compared with the smaller Chromebooks but very efficient. If you love Chromebooks then you will love this one. You hear lots of complaints about the battery but it seems to work great for me. It's perfect for traveling. Because the resolution is so high, the screen needs to be zoomed higher. The other complaint I hear is that because Netflix isn't 1080 HD then the picture doesn't look great. This is true but there are other sites that have 1080 HD and make this unit pretty fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Allan K. Pauole

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Really amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I love it. I'm not sure if I can find a bad thing to say about it really... It's fast, the screen is crisp, and it's really light. If you get the keyboard shortcuts down, then you'll be pretty set to do any task. It doesn't have a CAPSLOCK key and that takes some getting used to. The OS is a browser. If you're buying this or any other Chromebook, then you need to read up on what that entails. I like it a lot and this is DEFINITELY worth the 330-350$ I payed for it.
customer_reviews.author: Klowny

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality, consider a different model
customer_reviews.text: We have had this computer for several months now and are running into problems with the build quality. As far as Chromebook's go, the performance is good, but that does not help us when the bottom is about to fall off. A few of the screws have just fallen out and won't find grip when we try to put them back in. I would advise looking into a different new model than this one since most chromebooks are within spitting distance of each other from a performance perspective, and nearly identical in features.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Peters-Rodbell

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately you have a live person to talk to if ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick for my needs. I have an Epson printer that does not work with my Chromebook Toshiba. Very disappointing. So check out these features before you buy it. It didn't come with any papers any navigating tools, tutorials, nothing. Just the computer in a box. Fortunately you have a live person to talk to if you need help. There was quite a long waiting time to get him on the screen, but eventually he showed up. But there are lots of features that I would like to know and understand. Not to many people have this computer so it's hard to get help.
customer_reviews.author: floey1

customer_reviews.title: I love my Toshiba Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I love my Toshiba Chromebook ! Quiet keyboard that feels solid when typing ! I got used to the differences between windows and chrome fairly fast and actually like that there are some things I can't do on Chrome like save to desktop ! I save other stuff on a flash drive and like that as well as it is not junking up my laptop ! I also stream to my tv and that was really easy to set up and works well ! If you want a good computer for just simple surfing , Facebook or what ever , this is a good one to buy .
customer_reviews.author: jcreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Never lets me down
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about computers, so when people write reviews stating faults with this processor, or that graphics card it goes over my head for the most part. I have had this laptop for about a year now and it's still running strong. It has an HD display which is nice. It also has a very quick start up time (about 5 seconds). If you need a laptop just for going on the Internet, watching videos, or utilizing one of the myriad of google services such as docs and spreadsheets, I highly recommend this computer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Light, Great Resolution
customer_reviews.text: The Toshiba Chromebook does its job extremely well. The screen is very bright with great resolution. This is a fantastic bargain for those who essentially live with internet. There is virtually no memory (external works fine) and no tools like Word, and I knew that going in. The only problem is with the touchpad, which is, well, "touchy". I'm going to use a mouse in order to have more control, but, given its cost and the general excellence of the computer, that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kind Reader

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product - just not quite what I want!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a browser, reader, searcher, photo finder, etc. while watching TV. Product works great and does everything I required of it but I returned it due to its being bulkier than I wish to contend with. Loved the screen size as my eyes have not kept up with current products. Will probably end up with a tablet of some kind but am not willing to refinance our home for a stripped feature touch screen. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHROMEBOOK, DON'T HESITATE TO BUY YOU WON'T BE SORRY
customer_reviews.text: Let me say that I normally don't write reviews, But I love this device, the screen is stunning, battery like GREAT, keyboard great, BUT it isn't backlit which I really like in my Dell Inspiron laptop, The trackpad is great, I have seen YouTube videos criticizing it but I love it, it is very responsive, don't get me wrong it's not like a Macbook but it works great for the pricepoint as the cost of this Chromebook is 1/5 the price of a Macbook. It is fast, responsive and a great deal, I would not hesitate to buy a second one if I needed it. All in all its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: and wanted to have a better resolution, i purchased it
customer_reviews.text: since my non-hd version of toshiba chromebook 2 started to have a problem, and wanted to have a better resolution, i purchased it. have been used a couple of days.(will be add more later) well, this one is almost identical of the previous version except the screen resolution and design. pros: high resolution and moderate price. keyboard. touchpad. cons: less battery life & slower performance than the previous version. // design is bit wacky. haven't tested camera or other features yet because no need them much.
customer_reviews.author: Onkalo

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My child's school expects laptops from home. This chrome book does the job nicely for my freshman in high school. It's fairly lightweight and meets the requirements of being able to get to Google Docs, do research, and write papers and reports well at school. So far, so good! Update: Purchased mid-August. Stopped powering on yesterday, Oct 20th. Won't charge. No lights. Tested with a second working AC adapter with no results. After talking to support, we will send in for repair at our expense for outgoing shipping. From what I've read from other reviews, we are looking at several weeks before we know if it can be fixed. Until then, my teen has no laptop for school. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: "I'M GONNA DRESS YOU UP IN MY LOVE - ALL OVER YOUR BODY !"
customer_reviews.text: All the technical stuff about this chromebook has been said a thousand times over so I won't go there. I want to let people know that there are covers you can place on this chromebook that look amazing. There are also nice bags for this chromebook to protect your investment. I purchased both & it really makes this unit look even better as well as adding extra protection. I just want to add that everyone is talking about it's beautiful screen so hey, we may as well dress up the body too - just a thought !
customer_reviews.author: Indigo Fields

customer_reviews.title: If you have to have one for school this will do. Full HD Screen and decent audio
customer_reviews.text: I don't like Chromebooks. This is one of the better models because it has a 1080P screen and decent speaker system. I had to buy it for my daughter's school but now that she is in college it has become a boat anchor. Virtually impossible to print from. less than 6 months into the school year some of the screws fell out. But it's fairly inexpensive and if you have to have a chrome book I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: The display is truly awesome! I was a little concerned about the reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews I choose this Chromebook. The display is truly awesome! I was a little concerned about the reviews that indicated it might be slow with too many tabs open. I have not found this to be the case ... in fact, with 3 or less tabs open it is very fast. ( I compared it to my Dell PC w/ Windows 10 & an I5 processor) I should point out that I have a 50 MB internet connection, however that would not change the speed of the PC. Very happy with my purchase ... time will tell if it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Time Traveler

customer_reviews.title: it is very easy to use in low light because of the black ...
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a computer expert. I have had the 3340 Chromebook for about a week. It is just an outstanding unit. The screen resolution is just magnificent and the sound from the speakers is unlike any I have ever heard, outside of some very expensive setups. Although the keys are not back lit, it is very easy to use in low light because of the black keys contrasting with the silver case. I am a retired 70-something and this Chromebook fits my needs to a T. Could not be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: The IPS Screen makes this Chromebook awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Really Great ChromeBook. Hands down the best one available under or at $300. The screen is better than even the more expensive Acer's that have a "FHD" display. This IPS panel is a real difference. Performance wise, definitely not a monster as with youtube running an HD vid in the background while browsing I have heard some jitters almost as in buffering to keep up. Still this is noticed on all Chromebooks I have used so far even others that are much higher spec that this one. Never thought I would buy a Toshiba but hands down the Screen sold me on this one. The only better screen available is on the Pixel IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Luka

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but sub-par build quality
customer_reviews.text: The screen is great on this Chromebook, and performance overall is excellent. The keyboard is solid, not spongy like with some low cost laptops. It's not 5 stars because of the build quality: I had to have a replacement unit sent out because the display panel was crooked and off center inside the frame. I even had a bottom plate screw just fall out. Sadly, the replacement screen was even more crooked. Amazon's customer service was great as usual. They were even willing to send me a third but even they wondered if it would be any better. Overall a great laptop, but you might get a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A

customer_reviews.title: Love My Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Chromebook! It loads everything lightning fast, and I can watch streaming videos and movies with no problem and no lag in time. The HD quality is amazing. I didn't give it a five star rating solely because the keyboard is not easy to use. I need the keys to stand a little higher so that I can more easily feel the separation between the keys. I use my slow desktop computer for anything that doesn't need access to the internet, which means I turn it on maybe once a week. But I use my Chromebook all day every day!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for everyday use. Somewhat lacking for developers. In comparison to a mac air - The screen is sharp. Sharp as Retina. - Keyboard is more textured - Trackpad is lacking - Battery life is about 8 hours on regular browsing ChromeOS takes some getting used to. Developing has to be in the cloud (Cloud9 or nitrous.io) unless you boot up ubuntu with crouton, which I haven't yet tried. But if you're not a developer then this chromebook is an excellent, excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: mango

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap the screen is pretty. Really solid colors and very sharp. Bright too. Keeps up great with chrome os and handles basically anything you throw at it. I have used other chrome books and this is the best by far. Better screen, battery life, speed, than any other version. Built is ok it's mostly plastic but with a screen and weight like this I'm not complaing. Pretty build and good size. Good speakers as well. Well worth a pickup if you are looking for a simple fast little laptop.
customer_reviews.author: DevoW

customer_reviews.title: this is my nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, wife love it for internet use, which sucks, I can't even get any action from her, because she's on the dang thing all the time...wish, I never bought it for her... thanks, Mark Suckerberg for making facebook!
customer_reviews.author: skippyfixit

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE!
customer_reviews.text: TOO SLOW! The processor gets overwhelmed with only a few chrome tabs open and NOTHING ELSE! I don't understand it, my asus C201 chromebook blows this one away with like half the power. Might be a defective unit, but there's something to be said about Toshiba's Quality Control lately because this isn't the first time.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent chromebook with a great screen. Chances are, if you are in the market for a chromebook you aren't as concerned with processor speed as with other computer options. This laptop does not offer great processing speed, but it does the job for Web browsing, video streaming and other common Web functions. The screen is beautiful, and the laptop is gorgeous. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a computer that fits basic needs , and for someone who wants long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Williams

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop in 2015. 3 years later and I am still happy. The screen resolution for the price is outstanding, full HD with no lag or tearing on videos and movies. The 4gb of ram is more than enough to handle any workload through Chrome OS. I will consistently have 10+ tabs open in chrome, with video playing and items down/uploading with no lag. Even for a slightly older model Chromebook, for the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: boshando

customer_reviews.title: Honest Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Toshiba Chromebook in march 2016. This is a great internet device. It is crisp between web pages and is very stable. It has a great screen. Over all I give this Chromebook 4 out of 5 stars. They say this laptop will get the google play store but so far not so much. Don't know how good it would be on this machine without a touch screen. This is the only place this computer is lacking, apps would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: codyman

customer_reviews.title: The screen in gorgeous. Easy decision.
customer_reviews.text: The IPS screen is gorgeous on this 13.3-Inch 1080p model. That makes the choice of what Chromebook to buy a no-brainer given the price. How's the performance? It's decent. Nothing this cheap is going to knock your socks off. If an Nvidia Tegra based Chromebook came with this class of display, I would also consider that one. New Chromebooks can earn you an extra 1TB of Google Drive storage if activated before January 31, 2015 thanks to a promotion:
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better than a PC
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of viruses and update issues. I've had to have PCs "wiped" 3 times, at $100 each time. My son helped me pick out this Chromebook. It was top rated in Wired Magazine. (I think that's the name of the magazine.) I'm still in the 20th Century when it comes to tech stuff but I was able to set this Chromebook up all by myself. The keyboard is a little different but nothing I can't adapt to. The HD screen allows me to watch movies on Amazon Prime. This is one of the best purchases I've ever made from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Magda Dream

customer_reviews.title: The screen is much better than my Macbook Air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see what a Chromebook was all about and if it might have a use in the office as an inexpensive travel alternative. The screen is much better than my Macbook Air. It works flawlessly. I use outlook through web-access (although I had to google a workaround because the software blocks that sight). It is a great machine and a spectacular cheap alternative to a laptop for most uses.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Butwin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop. Check out my video review on it.
customer_reviews.text: This ChromeBook pretty much gets everything right. Good hardware design, big display, IPS, sufficient RAM, capable CPU and much more. Check out my super long video review on this Chromebook here:
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: simple and easy to use for what I am doing with it
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this system for what i bought it for, Basically email, social media, streaming Netflix to my TV. I am NOT using it for any real business applications. It seems lightning fast, simple and easy to use for what I am doing with it. I did notice that on some TV shows that had a lot of dark clothing and backgrounds that the Black looked a little weird. A backlit keyboard would be nice, but I knew it didn't have one going into the purchase so I can't ding it for not having one. I would absolutely recommend, in fact I already have recommended it to some friends, and bought a second unit for my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Really great HD screen
customer_reviews.text: Really great HD screen. Large resolution for lots of content and it's very bright too. It doesn't tilt back as far as I'd like, even for regular usage on my lap it's still a little too upright. Sound isn't anything special, despite the Skullcandy sticker. Battery time seems good. Charges quickly. Pity no other manufacturers have realized that ugly and heavy power supplies with huge cords are outdated. This power supply also gets very hot while charging from empty. To be fair they did put a sticker on it saying so.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long
customer_reviews.text: after a little over a year the thing is barely holding on. Randomly restarting if you put too much pressure on a corner of the keyboard, the hinges are falling apart, and the screen bezel is coming apart from the screen as screws are literally falling out. Screen itself has a permanent red/purple smudge on it after 3 months of use. I don't put laptops through a lot of abuse, but this thing isn't going to make it even two years. Spend the money on something with actual build quality and don't just fall for straight spec numbers like I did.
customer_reviews.author: JakeZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great/fast computer for the price. I was skeptical about buying my first Chromebook but I have to say that I am very satisfied. I'm able to download pretty much any app to handle programs that windows offers. For instance, since this is a Chromebook you cannot install Microsoft Office. However, you can download the free apps for each of the programs. You also have access to Googles versions of these programs for free as well. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Orion

customer_reviews.title: I love the device - use it every day
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect, but love it. Easy to use, easy to configure, reliable if handled with care. Good performance. I feel pleased with my purchase. We own 6 of these for family members. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: LOTSA' LUV DESPITE EARLY DAYS DRAWBACKS
customer_reviews.text: CONS: Text is very small unless zoomed considerably. PROS: Rich FHD screen Silent running Slower than I anticipated. Great audio output No overheating Trackpad is fussy Comfortable high accuracy keyboard Feels great to use Delete key absence is annoying Easy setup VPN Unbelievable battery life Some video files won't play (obviously) Multiple windows can be used at once Light as a feather You may want to hold onto your Mac or PC until the Chrome OS hits Glide. Once you start cloud computing you won't go back though. Don't compare it to other systems. It is a Chromebook. It is the future of computing and you sure can't beat the price. Endless storage Incredible battery life
customer_reviews.author: Susan Metcalfe

customer_reviews.title: Just a couple concerns with display
customer_reviews.text: Great HD screen and great sound. Screen seems a bit dark at times, even on max brightness. I haven't looked around to see if I can change those kinds of settings with something more than the brightness keys. When you're watching something dark you can see bright spots in a couple places on the edge of the screen. But other than that, it's a great Chromebook
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this Chromebook -- great screen resolution!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific Chromebook -- fast, reliable, lightweight and well-made. The screen resolution is fantastic. I bought this for my wife six months ago and recently purchased a second one for our family's use. We also purchased a Google Cloud-ready HP printer and found that it works best when using Google apps rather than Microsoft cloud apps (no surprise). Similar to another reviewer, about the only thing I honestly need a Windows/Mac for at this point is Quicken software.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Multiple windows open and it is still fast!
customer_reviews.text: I run a business and do most of my work in browsers so I thought I'd try a chromebook. I also run a podcast. I've had it for about 5 days and I have to say I love it. I've recorded a couple podcast episodes already and it went well. It's super fast. I always have many tabs open to do online marketing so I didn't want it to get slowed down. The battery lasts all day. The keyboard feels good too. The screen quality is awesome and there is a noticable difference with the speakers. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: jnellyk

customer_reviews.title: ... higher due to user error or failure to do better research, I don't know
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I should rate this higher due to user error or failure to do better research, I don't know. If you are looking for something that acts like a standard laptop, this is not for you. If you want something that allows you to surf the net, stream Netflix, access google products, you may love this. I tried using this for moving viseos from a go pro and photos from SD cards to memory sticks and the Chromebook just couldn't handle it. Also the download capacity is small. I highly recommend thoroughly researching before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: This Computer is perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This computer is perfect for surfing the web, checking e-mails and paying bills on-line. I wanted something compact and easy to carry on trips. The screen is fantastic in clarity and color. Wonderful product and would highly recommend it. Thanks again for offering it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for school. Perfect little device for that reason. All of my papers can be written in Google Docs and access to them is fast with this instant boot device. Fits nicely in my backpack, reducing the weight compared to a laptop. Easily manageable device. Fast and user friendly. If you are a Google apps user, this is the device for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Ubuntu + Steam
customer_reviews.text: After finding out the hard way with my last chromebook that ARM procs have issues running some linux apps, I was very happy to see that this one could not only let me run Ubuntu, but also install steam and wine. It is not nearly as powerful as my desktop gaming rig, but it is an awesome little toy when I am away from home. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Lord

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 11 months....and then...??
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Chromebook little less than one year ago and it has worked flawlessly until recently. I'm not sure if it needs a new battery or power supply or both? It will just die (shut down) with no warning even though battery icon says fully charged. If I plug in power supply it will work. Hmmmm.... Hope it's nothing serious. Will try to contact Toshiba and get back to you all..
customer_reviews.author: S. Kane

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily for ~5 years, very satisfied. Toshiba, please release a new version with more memory, because there is no any good replacement for the same amount of money after all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Slava Iakhymovych

customer_reviews.title: ... FB and shops on Amazon so this computer is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I am just your average computer user that does FB and shops on Amazon so this computer is perfect for me. I love it so much I may never go back to a "regular" windows computer again. I have an office job if I need to print something so I don't even have to deal with figuring out how to print at home. (as some people mentioned was a little bit of a hassle) I highly recommend. Fast, easy to use and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cucinotti

customer_reviews.title: Adobe Trained Web Designer - Loves his Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say - I am a power user. I have been running my web design business now for 4 years. I use a great deal of powerful software and plenty of machines. I have to say - I am heading to less is best. I walked away from Microsoft Products and have been suing Google Apps for Business (work) since their day one. The only drawback for me - I need Photoshop/Illustrator for the graphic part of my business. But I say this. That is all the heavy lifting I do with my other computers. I run by business exclusively with Google Apps. I picked the best computer to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Acme Dream Company

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite computer device (out of laptops, tablets, phones)
customer_reviews.text: It looks sleek and feels awesome. Battery life is excellent. Performance is amazing. I love my first Chromebook and look forward to watching these genius products evolve. The price was incredibly fair for what it offers. I use it mainly for writing and research for academic writing, and the Chrome Store has countless amazing Apps and Extensions that I've only scratched the surface of. I'll try to remember to update this review after I've had it for 6 months or a year (instead of just a few weeks).
customer_reviews.author: David Morgan

customer_reviews.title: This would have allowed for comfortable reclined use
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook performs just as described. The IPS display is very impressive. Some videos clip a little bit at full screen mode which is disappointing. Otherwise the only major design flaw is the display opening limitation. If you have a taller seated height, you may find it difficult to open the screen far enough to see the display at the proper angle. The current design seems to open to a very arbitrary stopping point. Ideally, this unit would have been designed to open nearly flat. This would have allowed for comfortable reclined use.
customer_reviews.author: lee.linden

customer_reviews.title: What you get when you want to just enjoy the internet & have fun!
customer_reviews.text: If you want something fast ,just to enjoy the internet - get this model. I already bought 2. Strictly for emails- playing games- watching vids or movies-surfing-listening to music and you'll get no hassles. The Chromebook is a fun book- a way to enjoy being online. I personally would not bother using it for work/productivity applications but the apps are there if you wish to.
customer_reviews.author: Comparison Shopping  Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, bright
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Beautiful, bright, and crystal clear screen. Multiple tabs open and function beautifully. Long lasting charge. Strong wifi signal. Excellent remote controller for my home PC via chrome share. Works well as ssh client. Even watched the Super Bowl 2015 on it!! Only gripe - No Native VMWare Horizon Viewer to remote into work. I realize HTML 5 remote access is available from VMware for RA- but it's not one of my options. Ummmm Just do it - Get one!
customer_reviews.author: dsringo

product_meta.title: Toshiba CB35-B3340 13.3 Inch Chromebook (Intel Celeron, 4GB, 16GB SSD, Silver) Full HD-Screen
product_meta.description:
Toshiba Chrome book 2 CB35-B3340 





Toshiba's Chromebook 2 is a refreshingly different type of computer, designed to help you get things done faster and be entertained from anywhere. Nothing complicated to learn. Starts in seconds. Stays up-to-date on its own. It's ready to work, ready to play and ready to go—right out of the box. 




See more and do more on a brilliant 13.3-inch diagonal, full HD (1080p) IPS display. Take in more of the web, comfortably work through your sheets, slides and docs, edit your latest home-movie masterpiece or just kick back and relax with your favorite TV shows and movies—all on a brilliant display that delivers the big picture in true-to-life detail. Or stream movies to your Chromecast enabled big-screen TV for larger-than-live entertainment.






Toshiba's Chromebook 2 pumps out some serious sound, thanks to fine tuning by the audiophiles at Skullcandy. Take charge of your music and relish in the rich, natural sound capabilities that only this Chromebook can offer. When music goes Google, all your music goes with you. Bring all your tracks, albums and playlist with you and introduce them to over 30 million more songs. Enjoy a complimentary 60-day unlimited music pass(2) with your Chromebook, so you can kick back and enjoy custom radio without rules. Then go ahead and listen anywhere, on any device—music is totally under your control.






With up to 9 hours of battery life,(1) Toshiba's Chromebook 2 is highly portable with a sleek and lightweight design. It weighs just 3 pounds, and features an all-new, sleek design.



Start up in seconds. Breeze through the web at lightning speed. Toshiba's Chromebook 2 is powered by an Intel Celeron processor, giving you impressive performance and versatility that your day demands.






HD movie and video streaming, gigabyte photos, music collections, games—today's digital life is all about connections. Toshiba's Chromebook 2 comes equipped with the latest dual-antenna 802.11ac Wi-Fi, so you can enjoy more speed, more coverage and greater connectivity speeds, plus the convenience of Bluetooth wireless connectivity.





Equipped with essential ports and features, like a USB 3.0 port for charging your smart phone and speedy file transfers, HDMI output for a multimonitor view, built-in webcam, security lock and an SD Card slot, Toshiba's Chromebook 2 can easily keep up with your everyday adventures.






Toshiba's Chromebook 2 is ready-made for video chats and voice-powered Apps, like Google+ Hangouts and Google Search. Equipped with dual-array microphones and an HD webcam, your live conversations will really come to life, while commanding searches using just your voice is a snap.



Personalize your Toshiba Chromebook 2 by adding a splash of color. Choose from the three colors of our custom-built soft matte finish covers. Designed by Toshiba to fit perfectly on our Chromebook 2, it will protect the computer while giving you full accessibility to all ports. Go ahead and show your colorful side. The covers are available in Charcoal, Aqua and Rose. (Sold Separately.)





A Chromebook is a new type of computer designed to help you get things done faster and easier. Powered by Google's Chrome OS, and featuring built-in, up-to-date virus protection along with Google apps and services like Gmail, Google Calendar, Docs and Google Play (plus thousands more in the Chrome Web Store). Unlike traditional PCs, Chromebooks update themselves automatically for free, so you always have the latest and greatest version, while your stuff stays safe with Google Drive online file storage that's automatically backed up. And Chromebooks play nicely with your other devices—your phone, tablet or another computer—so you can stay in sync with your day from wherever you are.





* https://play.google.com.
